comments.body: we should test what happens when the flag is toggled half-way through snackbar interactions. e.g. what if accessibility is enabled while it's animating in, or disabled while it's on the screen (does it now time out?) etc.

I've added a test that demonstrates the new snackbar behavior - enabling talkback or voiceover when the snackbar is open will prevent it from closing via timeout. disabling talkback or voiceover again will cause the snackbar to timeout after at most its timeout duration.
if it isn't text, should the test fail?
Nice! This is better because it tests for all SnackBar cases.

If you merge with upstream master, you'll notice that you need three more new theme properties:
```dart
      // ...
      radioTheme: const RadioThemeData(),
      switchTheme: const SwitchThemeData(),
      checkboxTheme: const CheckboxThemeData(),
```

      visualDensity: const VisualDensity(),
      primaryColor: Colors.black,
      primaryColorBrightness: Brightness.dark,

comments.body: Does this account for `TextDirection`? It may be worth adding a test that used `TextDirection.ltr` versus `TextDirection.rtl` to ensure the behavior is correct.
If it's to test the `SnackBar`'s `Dismissible` widget, I think it is already considered in `dismissible_test.dart`.
